name: Hotel Oxford

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently returned from a great vacation in Italy. Our stay at the Hotel Oxford made it all the more pleasant. Staff were very helpful and pleasant. Our room was well appointed and the breakfast offered was exceptionally good. Its location is also central to many of the sites making it easy to see as much of Rome as we did. Tante grazie a tutti!
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay in Roma

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Great hotel....well worth a visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Another successful stay

reviews.text: My husband and I recently travelled to Rome and stayed at the Hotel Oxford for 5 nights. We chose this hotel as it was a BA recommended hotel, we were not disappointed. The hotel is situated in a good location just off Via Veneto and near to many of the sights you visit Rome for. The Hotel is in a old building, which gives it a lot of charm and history; the lift wasn't huge so we used the stairs a lot. Our room was spacious (we upgraded to a superior room and it was great). I know it's not good for the environment, but having clean sheets and towels every day when you've been walking around a hot and dusty city is very much appreciated. Breakfasts were continental style and there was masses to choose from....you won't go hungry. The staff at the hotel were very polite and accommodating to any requests we had. We didn't use the hotel restaurant in the evenings as we found a few local restaurants in the back streets which were frequented by locals and they are worth searching out as the restaurants on Via Veneto are very expensive. All in all a great stay....would we recommend to friends and family.....too right we would!
reviews.title: Not Quite

reviews.text: The Hotel Oxford is a good quality 3*+ hotel (official rating is 4*), which is in a convenient location in Rome, to either walk to the sites or to the bus service / metro service. We stayed for one night before heading back to the UK, and was impressed with the levels of service and the large modern room we were given. The room was of a nice quality and had a huge bedroom, looking at the floor plan it must have been one of the biggest in the hotel, and had a King size bad and a second bed for my daughter, both were comfy. The room also has a safe, mini-bar and flat screen Sky TV, although not much was available on English. The bathroom was large with bath with an excellent shower (the window was controlled by a switch on the wall which was handy). One of the main things I noticed in this hotel was just how clean it was, I don’t think I have ever come across a room quite as clean as this, they must have excellent cleaning staff). The bar is nice (a little dated perhaps), and the staff are very friendly and accommodating, and the hotel has a restaurant although the menu looked quite limiting so we chose to eat out (which perhaps was a mistake, as the restaurant we ate at was not very good - see my review of Tempio di bacco).
reviews.title: Great Value for Money - Good Location

reviews.text: One thing to note is that we were in Rome on a Sunday this has some clear benefits - The city is more quiet, and there is a more casual atmosphere, however there are also disbenefits in that lots of shops are closed, along with some tourist attractions (especially the Vatican is a no-go for obvious reasons).
reviews.title: Out stay at the hotel Oxford Rome

reviews.text: I booked the hotel via BA Holidays and was able to obtain a better rate than direct / via the large hotel websites, it is one of their top recommendations and I have to agree it would be were I would stay again with family to get an excellent value nights stay.
reviews.title: Suited us perfectly

reviews.text: We recently returned to the Hotel Oxford fin Rome for 4 nights, this time with our two children. Our room was extremely comfortable and clean and the staff were always welcoming , friendly and extremely helpful. It is very close to many of the attractions that Rome has to offer and it was extremely close to a 'hop on, hop off bus service which made it easy to explore the sights. I would highly recommend this Hotel , we have stayed here twice and plan to go back. The breakfast buffet offered something to suit everyone's taste and although the evening menu was limited, the food was delicious and very reasonably priced and we ate there for 3 out of the four nights. For those who like to relax in the evening after a hectic day sightseeing, this Hotel has a fab lounge/bar area, where the staff ensure that you are looked after.
reviews.title: One of the nicest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My sister and I came for 4 nights to this hotel and it was perfect for our needs. A quiet, quality room and lovely bathroom, set at the back over a courtyard. It was clean and comfortable, an oasis in the middle of sightseeing in the hot and crowded city. The breakfasts were extremely good and plentiful with real variety, and the staff helpful. The price seemed very reasonable indeed for this accommodation and the hotel was in an excellent position for seeing the main sights of Rome. We would certainly recommend it. We were allowed to leave our bags in the hotel after checking out in the morning, while we spent a few last hours looking around before catching our flight. This was a great help.
reviews.title: all good

reviews.text: Me, my husband and our two sons (age 13 and 14) stayed in a family room at this hotel for 4 nights in July. Our room was great! Couldn't been better. Large, bright and clean. Large and very clean bathroom too. Our sons appreciated that they didn't had to sleep in a sofa bed ;-) We were welcomed with great service upon arrival by Katerina who gave us a map and pointed out 2 different buslines and recomended a lot of things to see. We know that continental breakfasts in Europe is "poor" so we were positively surprised by Oxfords breakfast. It contained a lot (even fresh fruit) and was very fresh and the hostesses kept refilling cheese, salami and turkey meat as soon as it was coming to an end so that it would stay fresh all the time. All of us was satisfied with breakfast and the hostesses were very nice. We never tried the restaurant but one evening when we were tired and came back late and didn't fell like going out for dinner, the bar made us great sandwiches with help from the kitchen. My family don't mind walking so for us the position of the hotel was great. Also since we could rest our tired feet by taking the bus if needed ;-) We felt "safe" in the neighborhood that were a little more "nicely" when you looked at the buildings and surroundings. The hotel building is very charming with character thanks to its narrow corridors and stairways. After four days we picked up our rental car. Both Avis and Hertz had their office a few minutes walk from the hotel (on a parallel street). We enjoyed our stay and our sons that it was free wi-fi ;-)
reviews.title: Suited us perfectly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh dear, what can we say about this 'hotel'. On arrival they put us in a cupboard, my wife and I together with our one suitcase could just about fit in. We have been all around the world but this had to be the smallest room ever. We did complain and were moved the next morning to a slightly larger room.
reviews.title: Not very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 'hotel' is very faded and in parts quite grubby, peeling wallpaper, faded carpets, leaking showers, furniture and beds stacked in corridor, very narrow staircase, etc. etc.
reviews.title: Very clean, very comfortable, very friendly and great value ...
five night trip to Rome
reviews.text: The breakfasts were provided in a smallish room and were a basic continental style which was OK. Location was good, we knew the area as we had stayed in Rome before.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar and barstaff were very friendly as were the general female staff. Would have to say the male 'management' were different, never a friendly word or smile.
reviews.title: Oxford Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Convenient location and friendly staff. Nice breakfast buffet, clean rooms, and very helpful front desk. Computer availability in lobby for 30 min. for 5 Euros. My husband left his camera in the lounge and the lovely lady behind the bar put it in a secure place and asked for my room number when claiming it, to verify it was ours. We felt she went the extra mile for a guest and was a good example of the accomodating and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Oxford Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was ideal for us. We came to Rome to spend as much time seeing Rome and not spending time in a Hotel. The hotel is absolutely fine, not top modern and chic, but clean and some may say a bit quirky.
reviews.title: Ideal Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Good room with friendly service while cheaper than many others

reviews.text: Hotel Oxford had some of the best, helpful and friendliest service I've come across in a long time.
reviews.title: Great Service and Location, would strongly recommend!

reviews.text: Breakfast was good, hot selections, apart from boiled eggs you got to pay for at a small expense, but there should be something for everybody to like otherwise. I would not have problems coming to stay here again.
reviews.title: Lovely Family Hotel

description: In Rome’s most exclusive area, Hotel Oxford is just behind Via Veneto and the Spanish Steps. Guest rooms feature elegant furnishings and wood or carpet floors. Experience the real Dolce Vita in this elegant setting. All rooms include free wi-fi, air conditioning and a private bathroom, and some have a balcony. Apartments are also available, and are in separate buildings in nearby Via Piave or Via Flavia ( suites/Apartments, free wi-fi with Kitchenette ).At the Oxford Hotel you have free Wi-Fi in all the areas. This Family-run hotel features a snack bar and a meeting room with a capacity of 25 people.Start your day with our new American buffet breakfast. In the evening, at Max's Bar, you can taste fresh snacks, cocktails and please try our pasta alla carbonara or amatriciana : we serve also good pizza..our chef prepare delicious tiramisu . Kids are always welcome.Hotel Rooms: 54
